com.vungle.sdk

Class VunglePub

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.vungle.sdk.VunglePub
  • Deprecated. 

    Please use VunglePub, VideoFullScreenAdActivity and MraidFullScreenAdActivity.

    If you are using this class, please ensure that you are using it with the associated classes in this package (you may not mix and match with the new classes in the com.vungle.publisher package):

    • VungleAdvert

    public final class VunglePub
extends java.lang.Object
    This is the public API for the VunglePub video ad monetization platform.
    See Also:
    VungleAdvert

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static interface  VunglePub.EventListener
      Deprecated. 
      Please use EventListener with VunglePub.addEventListeners(com.vungle.publisher.EventListener...) instead.
      static class  VunglePub.Gender
      Deprecated. 
      Please use Demographic.Gender instead.

    • Method Detail

      • getVersionString

        public static java.lang.String getVersionString()
        Deprecated. 
        Returns the version of the VunglePub SDK.
        Returns:
        the version of the VunglePub SDK.

      • init

        public static void init(android.content.Context context,
                        java.lang.String vungleAppId)
        Deprecated. 

        Initializes the VunglePub video monetization SDK.

        You must call either this method or init(Context, String, int, int) before calling any other method in this class.

        Parameters:
        context - your application's application or Activity Context.
        vungleAppId - your application's Vungle app ID on the Vungle Dashboard.

      • init

        public static void init(android.content.Context context,
                        java.lang.String vungleAppId,
                        int age,
                        int gender)
        Deprecated. 

        Initializes the VunglePub video monetization SDK.

        You must call either this method or init(Context, String) before calling any other method in this class.

        Parameters:
        context - your application's application or Activity Context.
        vungleAppId - your application's Vungle app ID on the Vungle Dashboard.
        age - the user's age, or 0 if unknown.
        gender - the user's gender - use one of the following:
        • VunglePub.Gender.FEMALE
        • VunglePub.Gender.MALE
        • VunglePub.Gender.UNKNOWN

      • setAutoRotation

        public static void setAutoRotation(boolean shouldAutoRotate)
        Deprecated. 
        Sets whether the video should auto-rotate with the user's device orientation, or the video should play in its native orientation (the default).
        Parameters:
        shouldAutoRotate - true if the video should auto-rotate; false if the video should play in its native orientation.

      • setBackButtonEnabled

        public static void setBackButtonEnabled(boolean isBackButtonEnabled)
        Deprecated. 
        Sets whether the Android back button should immediately allow the user to skip an interstitial (non-incentivized) video and jump to the post-roll (or exit the ad if it does not have a post-roll), or the back button should be disabled during the video (the default).
        Parameters:
        isBackButtonEnabled - true if the back button should immediately allow the user to skip the video; false if the back button should be disabled during the video.

      • setEventListener

        public static void setEventListener(VunglePub.EventListener eventListener)
        Deprecated. 
        Sets an optional VunglePub.EventListener to be notified of certain ad lifecycle events.
        Parameters:
        eventListener - the event listener to notify of ad lifecycle events.

      • setIncentivizedBackButtonEnabled

        public static void setIncentivizedBackButtonEnabled(boolean isBackButtonEnabled)
        Deprecated. 
        Sets whether the Android back button should allow the user to skip an incentivized video and jump to the post-roll (or exit the ad if it does not have a post-roll), or the back button should be disabled during the video(the default).
        Parameters:
        isBackButtonEnabled - true if the back button should allow the user to skip the video; false if the back button should be disabled during the video.

      • getSoundEnabled

        public static boolean getSoundEnabled()
        Deprecated. 

        Indicates whether the video will start with its sound matching the settings of your enclosing application (the default) or muted.

        Note that the user can still manually mute or unmute the sound during playback.

        Returns:
        true if the video should start with its audio settings matching those of your enclosing application; false if it should start muted.

      • setSoundEnabled

        public static void setSoundEnabled(boolean isSoundEnabled)
        Deprecated. 

        Sets whether the video should start with its sound matching the settings of your enclosing application (the default) or muted.

        Note that the user can still manually mute or unmute the sound during playback.

        Parameters:
        isSoundEnabled - true if the video should start with its audio settings matching those of your enclosing application; false if it should start muted.

      • isVideoAvailable

        public static boolean isVideoAvailable()
        Deprecated. 

        Indicates whether a video ad has been downloaded and is available to play.

        Reasons why an ad might not be available to play include the following:

        • init(Context, String) or init(Context, String, int, int) was not called
        • a video has not yet been downloaded
        • the device does not have internet connectivity
        • the device's storage is unavailable
        • another video ad was viewed too recently (you can modify this delay on the Vungle Dashboard)
        • the server doesn't have a video ad available to play
        Returns:
        true if an ad has been downloaded and is available to play; otherwise, returns false.

      • isVideoAvailable

        public static boolean isVideoAvailable(boolean debug)
        Deprecated. 

        Indicates whether a video ad has been downloaded and is available to play.

        Reasons why an ad might not be available to play include the following:

        • init(Context, String) or init(Context, String, int, int) was not called
        • a video has not yet been downloaded
        • the device does not have internet connectivity
        • the device's storage is unavailable
        • another video ad was viewed too recently (you can modify this delay on the Vungle Dashboard)
        • the server doesn't have a video ad available to play
        Parameters:
        debug - ignored (previously output detailed information about ad availability to LogCat if set to true).
        Returns:
        true if an ad has been downloaded and is available to display; otherwise, returns false.

      • displayAdvert

        public static boolean displayAdvert()
        Deprecated. 
        Attempts to play a VideoFullScreenAdActivity or MraidFullScreenAdActivity.
        Returns:
        true if a local cached ad was available; otherwise, returns false.

      • displayIncentivizedAdvert

        public static boolean displayIncentivizedAdvert(boolean showCloseButton)
        Deprecated. 
        Attempts to play an incentivized VideoFullScreenAdActivity or MraidFullScreenAdActivity. This method differs from displayAdvert() in that it will trigger a server-to-server callback if configured on the Vungle Dashboard.
        Parameters:
        showCloseButton - ignored - please set close button visibility on the Vungle Dashboard.
        Returns:
        true if a local cached ad was available; otherwise, returns false.

      • displayIncentivizedAdvert

        public static boolean displayIncentivizedAdvert(java.lang.String name,
                                                boolean showCloseButton)
        Deprecated. 
        Attempts to play an incentivized VideoFullScreenAdActivity or MraidFullScreenAdActivity. This method differs from displayAdvert() in that it will trigger a server-to-server callback if configured on the Vungle Dashboard.
        Parameters:
        name - the user name or ID in your application that should be rewarded for this incentivized view.
        showCloseButton - ignored - please set close button visibility on the Vungle Dashboard.
        Returns:
        true if a local cached ad was available; otherwise, returns false.

      • onPause

        public static void onPause()
        Deprecated. 
        Indicates a pause or the end of a user's session. It should be called in each of your Activity's onPause() methods.

      • onResume

        public static void onResume()
        Deprecated. 
        Indicates the start or continuation of a user's session. It should be called in each of your Activity's onResume() methods.
